intro: Proiphys cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's proiphys, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland areas. Proiphys cunninghamii is often found in heathlands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
